original: 'di'i cho ga ni bklags pa tsam gyis ma bsgrubs par las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di'i cho ga ni bklags pa tsam gyis ma bsgrubs par las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: By merely reciting this, without accomplishment, all activities will be accomplished.

original: klad nad dang / rims ldang dub can dang / ro langs dang / gdon rnams pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: klad nad dang / rims ldang dub can dang / ro langs dang / gdon rnams pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: Headaches, intermittent fevers, vetālas, and grahas will be defeated.

original: dran pa tsam gyis de dag thams cad kyis btang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa tsam gyis de dag thams cad kyis btang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely remembering it, all of them will be released.

original: bkres na grong du song ste lan bdun bzlas brjod byas te gdong la byugs na zas rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bkres na grong du song ste lan bdun bzlas brjod byas te gdong la byugs na zas rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is hungry, one should go to a village, incant one’s face seven times, and smear it. One will obtain food.

original: lce la bzlas brjod byas na shags 'gyed pa'i tshe lan thebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lce la bzlas brjod byas na shags 'gyed pa'i tshe lan thebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one incants one’s tongue, one will win in any debate.

original: lo ma'am / me tog gam /
analyzed: lo ma'am / me tog gam /
translated: One should incant a leaf, a flower,

original: 'bras bu la sngags nas su la byin pa de dga' @134b bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu la sngags nas su la byin pa de dga' @134b bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or a fruit, and give it to someone. That person will become pleased.

original: las grub pa'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
analyzed: las grub pa'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
translated: The dhāraṇī of accomplished activity is complete.
